values:
Sooo . . . Uncle Tom is visiting while Mom is in Texas. Dad needs his help to get the van working again. He just got here and will be staying a couple of weeks. Tom is one of Dad's younger brothers. Chris is the youngest, of all of Dad's siblings, and David is either older or younger than Tom, I'm not sure which. ^^; Dad is the eldest of seven. His sisters are Lisa, Laurie and uh . . . dangit, I always forget one! >.< *asks Dad* Trudy! Trudy's the oldest, Laurie's the youngest, and Lisa's in the middle.

Anyway, as much as I like Tom and we could use the company, I'm nervous about him being here. I'm also sick (sinuses are acting up), I didn't even know Tom was coming down until yesterday, and Sylvia has no idea he's here. At least Pocko isn't barking up a storm. He did bark for a bit, he just didn't keep it up.

Finally made arrangements with Cap. One to pay off my debt in two years. As in, I was finally able to talk to them when they called. I still stuttered and crap, but I managed not to cry/break down like before. Took long enough. Now I will be broke faster! Whoo! One less thing to worry about, at least.

I see my psychiatrist today at 3. I was suppose to see my doctor yesterday, but she rescheduled on me, dangit. Oh yeah, they're in the same building now, but she's only there in the morning and I prefer afternoon appointments. *sigh* Now I won't be able to see her until Oct. 1st, mid-morning of course.

I had a mental breakdown, thus causing a physical reaction making me incapable of . . . a lot. Certain things, like the topic of money, sets off a 'fit' that often causes twitching, spasms, rapid blinking/tightly closed eyes, severe stuttering/tightly closed mouth, lack of balance, immobility (can't walk if standing), crying/hysterical wailing. Since anxiety, stress, and emotions trigger these, I am not considered permanently disabled. There is a slim chance I could recover. However, I am also bi-polar type II, which is not going to go away and is a contributing factor in my disability.

My typing is strained, my fingers curling painfully even getting to something upsetting, like most of this entry. Tears are barely kept at bay, my mouth tightened in a grimace, and my eyes are threatening to 'shut out the world'. I cannot work. I am borderline agoraphobic, a hermit who REALLY does not want to leave the house. To do so is painful and takes a lot out of me. It takes me days to recover.

My hands are now clenching into fists, my nails biting into my palms, and my shoulders are tense. I have already taken my meds. Many are to help me 'chill', but the most they do is make me sleepy. I also have chronic fatigue syndrome (not yet medically verified) and 'chilling' just makes it worse. It's a catch-22. Get energy, I 'spaz' more; calm down, I'm too tired to do much. I can't win.

What made me decided to write about this? Sallie Mae. They keep pestering me for payments, but I've been getting forbearance(or is it deference?) because of my disability. However, if I could show it is permanent, they would let me off the hook. They just don't understand. Today, they tried talking me into joining any job search organization so they could put me on unemployment deference. Yeah . . . not happening. That would indicate I could work, but just don't currently have a job.

That call caused a 'fit'. Talking on the phone, especially about money owed, does that to me. I start stuttering and crying, and then need someone else to talk for me. If Mom hadn't had to wake me to talk to them, I might not have gotten as far as I did. Mom can't handle it, she's bi-polar too. It upsets her to see me get so upset. Dad is usually at work. Mom called him and got him to call them back to try to explain the situation.

I felt the need to write about this. When I had my beak down, I was taking college classes online. (Hence Sallie Mae breathing down my neck.) The twitches/tics/spasms were so bad, I couldn't continue. Typing, concentrating, working of any kind went down the crapper. I couldn't even walk without assistance. I have to use a cane to reduce the possibility of falling.

Now I am suffering arthritis-like joint pain. Great. As if all my other pain wasn't enough, now my joints have to complain when it's too cold for them or used too much for their liking. The clenching doesn't help, obviously.

. . . this is hurting too much.
My fever might not be 103, but it sure feels like it at times! Foreigner - Hot Blooded

Yup, joined FaceBook, too. ^^; You can find me here. If you have an account there, let me know and I'll friend ya! :aww: I'm also looking for more Bloodlines clan members. ^_~ Come on, play vampires with me! XD In other news, Dad left this morning for Texas. He should be back with Mom Saturday. Pocko and I can't wait! :D Pocko is Mom's red-head, "tea-cup" Chihuahua that she brought back last year. He doesn't like to be alone, which makes me feel needed even though he drives me crazy. >.< I am also considering doing $10 commissions. I'm not sure I can handle it, though. Er, not that I'd be in high demand and flooded with orders. ^^; I really need to scan my drawings before I decide, though. I would do 3D commissions, but I want to be diverse in options. Any thoughts on the matter?
Also dedicated to @RealMattDamon :P (not a confession, btw)
Guess what I am today XD
@Marcome: "May you feel the love in my heart reaching you in the next hours! Love your way!"
Ya gotta listen to this! It's a hoot! XD
Trust me. This is pure gold! (Bugs Bunny fans should recognize it ^_~)
via lola0813 again ^_^ This song is sooo me! XD
@DJLeesaK: "@DOCSTIMULAS: Sure am! Nothing but blue skies."

I'd do commissions, but they take me too long. So, I'm pushing my web hosting services. *pushpush* It's inexpensive and I do accept Paypal (I'd prefer it, actually). My Paypal account email is payment @ koojisites.com and I am able to send invoices/bills. Click the banner above for more information. Here's what one of my customers has to say about my services: "Everyone reading this, VLG has is a FANTASTIC webhost! I've been with Koojisites since about 2004 ( think ^^; ). No ads, options to create your own forums, FTP support, VERY decent pricing for a heck of a lot of space, SO much other stuff offered. And most importantly, VLG is super easy to contact if ever you need to speak to her about something with the website." - I'm seriously desperate here, folks.

I updated the "Male Me" renders.
Just changed the eyebrows and the shadows.




Male Me Close Up by =vlg on deviantART
Male Me by =vlg on deviantART

More than you ever wanted to know about me. =p

1) Do you like blue cheese?
I dunno. Never tasted it before.

2) Have you ever smoked heroin?
Nope and don't care to.

3) Do you own guns?
Not currently, but firearms are something I'm interested in. I blame Dad for that. ^_^

4) What flavor do you add to your drink at Sonic?
Vanilla and cherry

5) Do you get nervous before doctor appointment?
Yes, always.

7) Favorite Christmas song?
O, Holy Night and Silent Night

8) What do you prefer to drink in the morning?
Soda, but I plan to add coffee. Doctor's suggestion, if you can believe that. XD

9) Can you do push ups?
Only my bra. ^_^;

10) Can you do a chin up?
I can lift my chin, let's put it that way. ¬_¬;

11) What's your favorite piece of jewelry?
Rings, the finger kind

12) Favorite hobby?
Drawing

13) Ever been in a car wreck?
Not wrecks, but a few minor incidents.

14) Do you have A.D.D.?
Sometimes I wonder. ¬_¬; But, nah, just bipolar.

15) What's one trait that you hate about yourself?
Just one? My mental problems.

16) Middle name?
Ann

17) Name 3 thoughts at this exact moment?
I can't think. •_• Think of something! Anything! Wait a minute . . .

18) Name 3 things you bought yesterday?
Nothing, nothing, and, oh yeah, nothing!

19) Name 3 drinks you regularly drink?
Diet Dr. Pepper, Diet Dr. Pepper, and Diet Dr.Pepper. I'm a creature of habit. ^_^;

20) Current worry?
That I won't like coffee.

21) Current hate right now?
Phlegm. *hackcoughhacksnortspit* Ew. ¬_¬

23) How did you bring in the New Year?
It's a new year? When did that happen?!? O.o

24) Where would you like to go?
Japan and/or Alaska

25) Name three people who will complete this?
I dunno. Is anyone reading this?

26) Do you own slippers?
Yes, they are black, fuzzy, and overused. I don't wear them anymore, I need to just toss 'em.

27) What shirt are you wearing?
My over-sized dragon shirt. Very nice in warm weather, light-weight and airy. ^_^

28) Do you like sleeping on satin sheets?
Never had the pleasure.

29) Can you whistle?
Yup! *whistles a jaunty tune*

30) Favorite color?
Purple

31) Would you be a pirate?
Nah, couldn't hack it.

32) What songs do you sing in the shower?
Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star (don't knock it, I'm pretty good!) or whatever pops into my head.

33) Favorite girl's name?
Victoria

34) Favorite boy's name?
It's a tie between Nicholas and Alexander.

35) What's in your pocket?
I'm not wearing any. =p

36) Last thing that made you laugh.
TV show

37) Best bed sheets as a child?
The only sheets I can remember that weren't solid colors were CareBears.

38) Worst injury you've ever had?
I gouged my arm on the corner of flag-stone hearth. Left a good-sized scar on my left arm.

39) Do you love where you live?
Let me put it this way, I don't want to move.

40) How many TVs do you have in your house?
Five, currently.

41) Who is your loudest friend?
My sister =p

42) How many dogs do you have?
One, Pocko, Mom's chihuahua.

43) Does someone have a crush on you?
*snort* As if.

45) What is your favorite book?
I could neither pick a favored star out of the night sky than pick a favorite book.

46) What is your favorite candy?
Peanut M&M's with Mint M&M's a close second.

47) Favorite Sports Team?
Du'what? o.O

48) What song do you want played at your funeral?
Who Want's to Live Forever by Queen. That or a mixed medley of some of my favorite songs, including Barry Manilow's top hits. *starts whistling Copacabana*

49) What were you doing at 12 AM last night?
Sleeping, or at least trying to.

50) What was the first thing you thought of when you woke up?
I don't want to get up yet. *fell back asleep*

A close up view of male-me's face. ^^ A 3D representation of me as a man. ^^ Rendered in Daz Studio, using Daz's David figure w/ morphs. This is just to show what I have so far. I like him! :D I want to develop him further, give him his own texture so I don't have to rig others each time, and settle on hair for him. Then I could play with him more easily! :D . . . deja vu O.o

Click image for DA page and full view. ^^

Yup, it's official. I've been diagnosed as being bi-polar type 2. What's the difference? Type 2's don't have extreme highs, just extreme lows and okays/normals. =.= So I don't get hyper active and go crazy doing stuff every now and then. I just get to a point where I can do some things for a while, but not very keyed up. That's as high as I get. When I plummet, which is often, I don't want to do much, if anything. Just taking my meds is tasking.

On the up side, I may be getting in-home assistance to help with everyday stuff and to help with appointments and such. That would take some pressure off of Mom and Dad. Hell, Mom could use some assistance, too. She's also bi-polar, but with some actual highs. But since Mom and I are often "down" at the same time, Dad has to come home to take care of us even though he's tired, poor guy.What we really need is someone to come in everyday to cook and clean. My helper would only do light cleaning in my area and cook maybe one meal for me (besides the other stuff), just me. We need a regular cook and maid around here, especially since Pocko arrived.

Oh, yeah. Pocko. He's the little chihuahua Mom brought back from Texas. He has more energy than all of us put together, and that includes our three cats. @.@; He's fun to watch, though. ^_^ I just wish he was house-trained and knew what outside was for. =.=; He just loves to tear things up, like paper and tissue, and there's plenty of that strewn all over the house. Yeeeeeaaaah . . . Plus, he's not fixed yet. Gotta keep him from spraying down the house. It's a good thing he's cute, with those big ears of his.

Meh.

Surprised? =P Rendered in Daz Studio using Victoria 4, AS's Stily, August Hair, Sara face morph, Secret Window, and a ground prop barely naticable out the window that I got somewhere. Teaser pic: 1024x768 Seductive Sara 800x600 Seductive Sara And it's not even a GUY! How shocking is that! *faint*

I was denied disability. I have to make an appeal now. Keep trying.

Dad has been in the hospital for the past few days. He has a cellulitous infection in his left leg. He had been just staying home with his leg up and taking antibiotics, but after about two weeks the doctor figured it would take him two months to heal at that rate. So, he's been in the hospital hooked up to an IV to speed up the process. Dad comes home today. He'll still be taking pills and won't be able to go back to work until Thursday (or so). He's already missed two weeks of work. The only good thing about this is that he finally got some rest. Usually when he's home he has four dozen things to do, plus whatever comes up. There's really not much you can do when you have to keep your leg up.

After Dad was hospitalized and I received the disability rejection letters, I had an emotional breakdown. I'd never cried so much at one time before. The next day I was kind of numb. I started to carve up my desktop again. Fiercely. I pretty much slept through Friday. I took a nap a few hours after I got up and woke up at 11:30 pm, nearly 10 hours later. The second day of brutalizing my desk  I almost came to tears a few times, but the first day I didn't really feel anything other than the pain in my hand from the repetitive stabbing and scraping with my letter opener and the rough texture I was creating. I first scarred up my desk way back in 1997, after I graduated and we moved to another house in the neighborhood, but before my first antidepressants started to work. Yeah, I have issues. But you all knew that already.

Well, at least my Mac is fixed. Oh, and I received my first paid commission! From Mandy, of course. She's the only one who commissions me, but this time she pre-paid for a female orc. I need to scan what I've got drawn and get some more details about what she wants. That would require uncovering my scanner, though, and I'm not sure I'm up for that kind of physical labor yet! XD Where am I gonna put all that stuff? My bed is already a dumping ground for stuff I haven't found a place for yet, and I'm sick off uncovering it every time I want to sleep. =.=

I'm tired. I just want to give up. Don't worry, I'm not suicidal. I just don't see the point in my living.

Dad's home. I'm crying. Later, tater.

…were good. No indication of seizures. The neurologist believes it’s an involuntary muscle movement that will eventually go away. She also thinks I should drop my classes for this term as college is one of my biggest stress factors, and stress/anxiety just makes the twitching worse. I can’t work like this anyway. She also recommended I apply for disability. I’m doing both. I’ve already emailed my advisor and my counselor will help me with the disability application. Coincidentally, it had been suggested before all this that I apply for disability, but now it’s really evident that I’m quite disabled. The twitching also makes it hard to talk, but now I have an excuse for my poor verbal skills. ^^;

As for the Paxil, the doctor thinks my dose should be increased, which is what I was thinking before the twitching started. I see my psychiatrist Thursday, so we’ll see what happens with my meds then. I’m also suppose to see my counselor two to three times a week so he can check up on how I’m doing.

I twitched the worst when money was discussed for my EEG and doctor’s appointment. Dad didn’t think the EEG was necessary and that I should just stop taking Paxil. He put down $40 on a $400-$700 test. They wanted half for the doctor’s visit up front, which costs about $300, but accepted $100. Dad almost decided to forget it and just go home, but I’d already had the test done and all. I was twitching so bad, I couldn’t talk, I could barely walk, and my face was scrunched up so hard I could barely see and my forehead muscles were seriously strained. It felt like something was going to rupture. I looked like this -->> (>.<) only worse.

Imagine Dad's surprise when even the neurologist didn't tell me to stop taking Paxil. So, it wasn't a waste of time and money, and if I just stopped taking the Paxil like Dad said I should do instead of taking the EEG, things could have gotten worse. For one, I'd be going through some serious withdrawal symptoms AND twitching all over the place. XD

In other news, Nana repo-ed her bed. I'm back to a twin, but with two mattresses on top of the box springs. ^^ It's taaaaaall! I hope I don't fall off! XD It's springy! ^^ I was able to make it up myself without twitching, so I'm not completely useless. =P We're still figuring out what I can and can't do, but being around people, even family, makes me twitch. I can't drive now, it makes me too nervous. ^^; I do better when I'm alone in my room, but I get lonely. ^^; At least my mood is improving. ^^

I made some bookmarks featuring Nick’s cute rear on card stock paper (it’s sturdier). I figured I’d might actually make money by selling a lot of inexpensive things than by trying to sell a few costly things. Anyway, there are three types of bookmarks: A. High quality, B. slightly larger, but lower quality, and C. “oops!”, A’s that the printer cropped, but still feature Nick’s rear. ^^ A’s are $2 (plus shipping), B’s are $1 (plus shipping), and C’s are for those who can’t afford A’s or B’s, but can send me a self-addressed, stamped envelope (limit one per person, while supplies last). ^^ Shipping is the price of a stamp (for up to 5 bookmarks). If mailing in the payment (check or money order), you can include a self-addressed, stamped envelope in lieu of adding the cost of a stamp. Paypal orders will have to include the cost. Speaking of Paypal, I can only accept paypal or bank funds, otherwise there are fees attached. You can still reserve a bookmark while funds are being transfered, and it will be mailed as soon as I receive payment. Check orders will be held until the check clears. I do take requests, so if there is any of my images you’d like a bookmark of, just ask! ^^

New low prices! Get 'em while they're cheap! XD You can get any one of them AT COST! I'd be losing money at these prices! No eBay account? No problem! You can buy directly from me! ^__^ Or from my DA print shop! These are high-quality, 16" x 24" prints. (more sizes with smaller prices at my DA print shop) The paper is thick and can prevent fading for up to 60 years! I won't even live that long. O.o All proceeds will go towards my medical bills of over $2,500 (to date). ;3;
BOOYAH! :D

Apparently, Dad makes too much for me to get medical assitence. So, I’m selling prints (from DA) off of eBay. ^^ Check ‘em out! :D I’m selling two 16x24 prints (”A Day at the Park” and “Your Love Gives Me WINGS!”) and one 16x20 print (”Coko Neko”). A Day at the Park Your Love Gives Me WINGS! Coko Neko

On the 9th (end of the first week of classes), my Mac Mini's hard drive crashed (missed a project). On the 15th (almost end of week 2), I was able to resurrect it with an external hard drive, which was my mother's old internal hard drive (one project turned in late). On the 21st (today, near the end of week 3), that hard drive crashed. I replaced it with another old previously internal hard drive, but it didn't even get as far as installing the OS. My Mac can't even see it now. =.= Right now, my Mac's dead in the water and there's only so much I can do with my PC. On top of that, my mental and physical state has deteriated.  Some of my schoolwork I can't do because of my Mac problem, the rest I can't work on because of my fragile mental state. Tomorrow, I am using some of my savings to by a new hard drive at Walmart. This is my last chance.

Besides all that, today I went to Behavorial Health Services to fill in papers to start therapy. I was suppose to go Wednesday, but I forgot and missed my appointment, so I rescheduled for today. It was more emotionally draining than I expected, so it's a good thing Mom went with me. Next week they'll call to set up an appointment. Another medical expense, yay. I'm praying I'll qualify for the county program. That will cover both my doctor's office and my therapist.

A little good news, I registered panixstudios.com yesterday. There's nothing there, yet, but I'm planning to use it for my portfolio and more professional type stuffs. Speaking of which, Mom invested in my art by buying some of my prints from DA's shop, which I will be selling on eBay as soon as I get the shipping & handling figured out. The profit I make from them (I'm trying to be positive here) will be put towards buying more prints to sell. ^^ I'll let you know when they're up in case anyone is interested.

I forgot to mention that I lost some files when my hard drive died on me, but not everything. I lost  Mandy's fairy pic (which I was going to turn into a print). Fortunately, I sent her a jpg preview of the linework so I won't have to start from scratch once I get my Mac working again.

...I need more diverse userpics. None of them quite express what I'm going through right now. I was going to upgrade my LJ (I know I hardly use it, hush!), but I'll have to wait now. Oh well, no big deal. I have bigger problems to cry over, and I do. Frequently. Like now.

Damnit!

For as long as I can remember, something has always hurt. But then, I can't remember very far back, so I may have lived without pain before and just not remember it. ^^; I'm used to a certain level of pain. On a scale of 1 to 5, I can pretty much ignore up to a 2 in the usual places, a 3 is not unusual in my day-to-day pain, 4 pops up every now and then, and while a 5 is rare, it occurs far more often than I care for. The 4's and 5's are usually a combination of pains, though.

I bring this up because I might have Chronic Fatigue Syndrome like my grandmother. CFS starts with a genetic disposition (check), and can be triggered by different things, like chronic allergies (in spades). I have many of the symptoms, the worst of which is constant fatigue (and muscle/joint pain). I am always tired. There is no cure for CFS, the only thing that can be done is to treat the symptoms and educate those who need to know what it is, how it affects me, and what to expect/not to expect.

Now, I mention this because I feel I should let people know that while I can be quick to watch someone/fav a piece, I reserve commenting to what really moves me to say something. Typing is one of the things that tires me. You wouldn't think it would be that bad, but it does. Usually by the time I think of something to say, I've lost the motivation to type. Since most of my school work involves typing, I really need to save as much of my "typing energy" for school. This alone is taking me over a half hour to type up. Make that almost 45 minutes.

You may have noticed noticed I've used only one smilie up to this point. This is because I'm being serious and I'm not really in a "smilies" mood. I'm not looking for sympathy, I just wanted to explain. Take that as you will.

It's past 50 minutes now. I'm going to bed.

I don't usually do this, but I need help with a writing assignment. The topic is gender issues and I can write on any gender issue topic, but I'm having trouble picking something. I also have to find some articles/essays whatever on gender issue topics. Any topic, it doesn't matter. So, if you know of an article/essay or even a rather poignant journal entry, please give me a link to it/them.

Also, if you have any ideas for a specific topic I could write about, I'm all ears! Any books I should check out, tell me! Any websites that might be of help, let me know!

By gender issues, I mean women's issues, men's issues, men vs. women issues, men and women's issues, etc. Similarities, differences, equality or lack there of, mainly affects women, mainly affects men, general misunderstandings, general underestimating/overestimating, hate, discrimination, and so on.

Right now, I need general gender issue articles/essays by Saturday, but the paper on a specific topic isn't due until May 7th (I think). Since I still need to narrow down on a topic, any ideas/links/writings would be of great help. ^^

Thanks in advance!
